Sequence Information.Peptide Name: S. marcescens bacteriocin (natural AMPs, SM_bacteriocin, gram-negative bacteria, prokaryotes)

Literature.Author: Mousavi SM, Archangi B, Zamani I. 2023
Literature.Title: Antibacterial Properties of Bacteriocin Purified from Serratia marcescens and Computerized Assessment of its Interaction with Antigen 43 in Escherichia coli.

Sequence Information.Comments: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is similar (71.43%) toMicrocin C7each: 20%.Chemical modification: sidechain amide of N5 is modified with PHCH2OH.Activity: disk diffusion assay: active against E. coli, but not P.aeruginosa PTCC 1707, S.marcescens PTCC 1621, V.fischeri PTCC 1693, and V.harveyi PTCC 1755.Warning: other bacteria not tested (activity against Gram-positive bacteria unknown).
